message_1: Let set A = {1, 3, 5, 7, 9} and set B = {2, 4, 6, 8, 10}. Find the value of (A ∩ B) ∪ A.
message_2:
First, we find the intersection of sets A and B (A ∩ B). Since set A contains only odd numbers and set B contains only even numbers, there are no common elements between the two sets. Therefore, A ∩ B = {} (the empty set).

Now, we find the union of (A ∩ B) and A. Since (A ∩ B) is the empty set, the union of the two sets will simply be set A itself.

So, (A ∩ B) ∪ A = A = {1, 3, 5, 7, 9}.
